Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
02/25/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1) An institution shall maintain employee records for
each employee and shall include documentation of all
of the following information prior to employment or at
the time specified in this rule:
(g) If the employee has criminal convictions, the
institution shall complete a written evaluation of
the convictions that addresses the nature of the
conviction, the length of time since the conviction,
and the relationship of the conviction to regulated
2

activity for the purpose of determining suitability
for employment in the institution.
One out of one applicable employee files reviewed did not contain a required
assessment by the facility of their criminal history prior to hire.

Agency has an approved seclusion variance. One out of three currently placed
youth files reviewed contained improper documentation of eyes on checks during
the use of seclusion.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical assistance was provided regarding yearly child abuse & neglect
registry clearances. When new employees are hired and this clearance is
received not more than 30 days prior to the start of employment, they then
would need to have the clearance completed again every 12 months
thereafter.
• Technical assistance was provided in the area of discharge planning and
providing clarity on which staff and supervision write and approve/sign off
on youth case file documentation respectively.
3

V. CONSULTATION
The agency did not request or require consultation during this inspection.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The facility had two Corrective Action Plans approved during this reporting period.
The first came from the previous renewal inspection, approved on 12/01/2023.
This action plan contained action items for four rule violations. The first three were
regarding youth case files and discharge planning. Action items included the
reformatting of the template used for that documentation. The last rule violation
was regarding employee evaluations and the resulting action item required
different tracking for those tasks. This corrective action plan was successfully
implemented in that these rules were not repeat violations during this inspection.
One special investigation resulted in a rule violation during this reporting period,
2024SIC0001536. The resulting corrective action plan was approved as of
09/03/2024. The action items in this plan were specific to the proper
documentation of certain information within discharge planning. As of the time of
this inspection this rule has not been found to be of concern.
Financial Overview
Yearly budgeting for the facility was provided by the overseeing organization and
no concerns were noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator completed the required assessment on 01/02/2025. This
assessed previous rule violations and required action items as well as patterns of
discharged youth.
4

Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff were interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility
02/04/2025. Staff reported being supported in their roles, receiving adequate
training and having good experiences working with the youth placed in the
program.
Youth were interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility
02/04/2025. The youth reported positive experiences participating in the program.
One youth stated they enjoyed the food at the facility. They all stated that their
basic needs were being met, and they felt safe in the program.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through of the entire facility was completed on 2/4/2025. The facility was
well maintained, clean, and well organized. All bedrooms in use had appropriate
bedding. The bathrooms were viewed to have running water, working toilets,
working sinks and working showers. All client files and medications were locked up.
The school office and classrooms were viewed. There were no safety concerns
noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
